sentences.sContent: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
sentences.sCn: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。

sentences.sContent: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
sentences.sCn: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

remMethod.val: 上课的时候， 要(need)格外留心(heed)老师讲了些什么

words.tran: 注意的；深切注意的；深切留心的
掉以轻心地；不加注意地

trans.tranOther: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning
